verses.roman:
ei artha--madhyama, śuna 'gūḍha' artha āra
tina āvāsa-sthāna kṛṣṇera śāstre khyāti yāra

synonyms: ei artha—this explanation; madhyama—middle; śuna—please hear; gūḍha—confidential; artha—meaning; āra—another; tina—three; āvāsa-sthāna—residential places; kṛṣṇera—of Lord Kṛṣṇa; śāstre—in the revealed scriptures; khyāti—fame; yāra—of which.
translation: "This is the middle meaning. Now please hear the confidential meaning. Lord Kṛṣṇa has three places of residence, which are well known from revealed scriptures.

purport.content: Kṛṣṇa has three abodes-His internal abode (Goloka Vṛndāvana), His intermediate abode (the spiritual sky), and His external abode (this material world).
